question: 求人
sourceMnemonic: When you're <kanji>request</kanji>ing <kanji>people</kanji>, you put up a <vocabulary>job posting</vocabulary> because you’re <vocabulary>seeking workers</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

As you're looking at <vocabulary>job posting</vocabulary>s, you notice they're all looking for people with <reading>cu</reading>cumbers and <reading>jean</reading>s (<ja>きゅうじん</ja>). That's the only qualification they're after, cucumbers and jeans.
